GUI

Class WaveformEditor

  • java.lang.Object
    • GUI.WaveformEditor

  • public class WaveformEditor
extends java.lang.Object
    Editor window for a waveform. Allows minor editing, addition of effects and provides information

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      WaveformEditor(double fileLength, int index, java.io.File f, Track track, javafx.scene.layout.StackPane waveformStack, WaveformCanvas canvas, TrackLineGUI TLG)
      Constructor for the editor window

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      Adds a delay effect to an AudioData object.

      Adds a distortion effect to an AudioData object.
      void addFadeIn()
      Adds a fade-in effect to an AudioData object.
      void addFadeOut()
      Adds a fade-out effect to an AudioData object.
      void addFaze()
      Adds a faze effect to an AudioData object.
      void addNoiseGate()
      Adds a delay effect to an AudioData object.
      static void canvasZoom(javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas canvas, java.lang.String filePath, boolean increase)
      Apply a zoom-in or zoom-out effect to the WaveformEditor's canvas
      void createEditor()
      Creates an editor window for the specified AudioData object.
      void duplicate()
      Adds a copy of the audio block to the track.
      float findMinAndMax()
      Finds the largest number that is stored in a stereo float array, regardless of whether the value is positive or negative
      java.lang.String formatName(java.lang.String unformattedString)
      Formats a string, namely the name of the file object, so that each line is exactly 15 characters in length
      void setStartTime()
      Sets the starting time for an AudioData object.
      void trim()
      Trims a block of audio between to user-given values.

    • Constructor Detail

      • WaveformEditor

        public WaveformEditor(double fileLength,
                      int index,
                      java.io.File f,
                      Track track,
                      javafx.scene.layout.StackPane waveformStack,
                      WaveformCanvas canvas,
                      TrackLineGUI TLG)
        Constructor for the editor window
        Parameters:
        fileLength - - Duration of a given file
        index - - Index within the trackline
        f - - File that relates to the waveform
        track - - audio track
        waveformStack - - Parent stack pane
        canvas - - Canvas the waveform is drawn on
        TLG - - TracklineGui parent

    • Method Detail

      • createEditor

        public void createEditor()
        Creates an editor window for the specified AudioData object. From here the user can get information about the file, make arrangement adjustments and apply effects.

      • canvasZoom

        public static void canvasZoom(javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas canvas,
                              java.lang.String filePath,
                              boolean increase)
        Apply a zoom-in or zoom-out effect to the WaveformEditor's canvas
        Parameters:
        canvas - The canvas to apply the transformation to
        filePath - The filepath for the file object
        increase - Determined by if the user has selected zoom-in or zoom-out

      • addFadeIn

        public void addFadeIn()
        Adds a fade-in effect to an AudioData object. A window will pop up where the user can enter the desired time for the effect to be applied to

      • addFadeOut

        public void addFadeOut()
        Adds a fade-out effect to an AudioData object. A window will pop up where the user can enter the desired time for the effect to be applied to

      • addDistortionEffect

        public void addDistortionEffect()
        Adds a distortion effect to an AudioData object. A window will pop up where the user can enter the desired threshold for the effect

      • addDelayEffect

        public void addDelayEffect()
        Adds a delay effect to an AudioData object. A window will pop up where the user can enter the desired parameters for the effect

      • addNoiseGate

        public void addNoiseGate()
        Adds a delay effect to an AudioData object. A window will pop up where the user can enter the desired parameters for the effect

      • findMinAndMax

        public float findMinAndMax()
        Finds the largest number that is stored in a stereo float array, regardless of whether the value is positive or negative
        Returns:
        The largest number stored in the array

      • addFaze

        public void addFaze()
        Adds a faze effect to an AudioData object. A window will pop up where the user can enter the desired speed for the effect

      • trim

        public void trim()
        Trims a block of audio between to user-given values. The original waveform is removed from the GUI and a new waveform is generated and added.

      • setStartTime

        public void setStartTime()
        Sets the starting time for an AudioData object. A window will pop up where the user can enter the desired time

      • duplicate

        public void duplicate()
        Adds a copy of the audio block to the track. Since the file object is being passed as a parameter, only the original audio file will be duplicated, any applied effects will not be

      • formatName

        public java.lang.String formatName(java.lang.String unformattedString)
        Formats a string, namely the name of the file object, so that each line is exactly 15 characters in length
        Returns:
        A string with formatted line length
